content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: simple and efficient
(and he's my student!)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: a fun puzzle with a nice visual output
the testcases are especially good for reverse as they do capture all the relevant edge cases like 0,0 or 4,4 and others.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clair, faisable en moins de 5 minutes, je suis cependant d'accords avec le commentaire ci-dessous qui dit que la map est un peu restreinte à mon goût, peut être l’agrandir jusqu'à entre dix et 30, à essayer, sinon l'idée est bonne  ;)
I feel like the length constraint is overestimated. Maybe you should make the upper bound something close to 30, or if you wanna give the exact number: "4 < [[L]] ≤ 30".

Usually, the coordinates are in the same lines, separated by a space.
For a CoC, it is perhaps preferable not to vary the length (10 seems sufficient), so it can be in all modes: fastest, reverse and shortest ^^

The terms "X axis" and "Y axis" commonly refer to the lines crossing all the points where y = 0 and x = 0 respectively. The way you use them does not follow that common usage at all.

Also you have confused the clash requirements with constraints. The first four lines in Constraints section should be moved to Goal section.

"(0,0 is in the upper left corner)" should also be moved to Goal section.

"|", "-", "+", "." may be formatted as {{constants}} with the quotation marks removed.

Other comments:

Input section
* Please add line numbers and variable types, e.g.
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[l]] for the length of one side of the map.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[x]] for (etc.)
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[y]] for (etc.)

Constraints section
* Please format all the [[variables]].
* x, y may be 0 in the cases so ≤ should be used instead of <.

Thanks.
ok thanks i just fixed that
